result:
## Bug Hunting Complete! 🐛

I've successfully found **2 legitimate bugs** in `pyramid.resource`/`pyramid.asset`:

### Bug 1: Backslash Handling on Unix
- **File**: `bug_report_pyramid_asset_2025-08-18_20-49_xe6w.md`
- **Issue**: Single backslash `\` incorrectly treated as absolute path on Unix
- **Severity**: Low

### Bug 2: Empty Package Name Crash
- **File**: `bug_report_pyramid_asset_2025-08-18_20-49_ebpm.md`
- **Issue**: Empty/invalid package names cause crashes instead of graceful handling
- **Severity**: Medium

### Properties Tested
✅ Absolute path invariant in resolve_asset_spec
✅ Colon parsing in resolve_asset_spec  
✅ Package name conversion with __name__ attribute
✅ Empty string edge cases
✅ Unicode character handling
✅ Very long path handling

The property-based testing approach successfully uncovered edge cases that would be easy to miss with traditional unit testing!

tool_input.description: Check if pyramid.resource exists in venv

tool_input.command: source /root/hypothesis-llm/envs/pyramid_env/bin/activate && python3 -c "import pyramid; print('pyramid version:', pyramid.__version__)"
tool_input.description: Check if pyramid is installed in venv

tool_input.command: cd /root/hypothesis-llm/envs/pyramid_env && bin/python3 -c "import pyramid; print('pyramid version:', pyramid.__version__)"
